channel.title: Debt on I Make Things
channel.description: Recent content in Debt on I Make Things

item.title: 2023 Year In Review
Personal Finance, Q4 2018 Update
Personal Finance, Part 3
item.description: In part 2, I mentioned that I’m “productively lazy,” and prefer to automate what I can. Well, I’ve managed to do that with my finances. Hello, Automation! My husband finally got officially hired by his work, which converted him to salary. This gave us two benefits – 1. his income is no longer locked to his hours, so the paychecks are the same, and 2. he and I are now on the same pay schedule (which makes for a really pretty number on payday).

item.title: Personal Finance, Part 2
item.description: Back in part 1 I described the system that I used to work on getting my family out of debt and make ends meet. We’re now coming up on a year, so how did I do? Does this system actually work? Putting The System To Work So, did it work? Well, as an acquaintance put it, there was “no budge in the budget,” but…yeah, it has been working. In fact, it saved our hides when things fell apart a few months ago.

item.title: Getting Started With Personal Finance
item.description: I could have sworn I wrote earlier about how one of the things I was planning on doing was personal finance and money-making outside of a typical 9-5. Oh well, if I haven’t said it before, I’ll say it now – I find it annoying that there seems to be a gap between “flat broke with zero personal finance knowledge” and “personal finance guru,” and I’d like to bridge that gap, while I’m crossing it.
